Items.name: Items
Items.text:
This appendix presents both magical and nonmagical items. Each item has a name, two lines of metadata (the bits in italics), and the item's function. For nonmagical items, the first line of metadata shows the item type as well as its 'off-the-shelf' purchase value and weight. The second line details the duration, DC, and tools required for the Manufacturing check to make such an item (see Heliana's Guide to Monster Hunting for the full Crafting mechanics).

For magic items, the first line of metadata shows the item's type, rarity, and attunement requirements (if any). The second, 'Component' line details the magical component needed to craft this item using the Enchanting and/or Forging rules from Heliana's Guide. These components can be harvested from slain creatures (see Heliana's for the full Harvesting mechanics).

Magic items also present rarity variants for the items. These are instructions of how to change the item's text to create a variant of the item that is balanced for a different rarity. Rarer items are more powerful than less rare items (see Heliana's Guide or L'Arsene's Ledger of Treasures and Trinkets for more on rarity variants).

Magic items.name: Magic items
Magic items.text:
@UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.DdnWilWK0aTyGMLf]{Infested Cultist's Skull}

@Embed[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.DdnWilWK0aTyGMLf]

Very rare variant: Replace guiding bolt with @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.pybg5MNc3lkerH4Y]{blight} (save DC 16).

  • @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.DdnWilWK0aTyGMLf]{Infested Cultist's Skull (Uncommon)}

  • @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.fltozneYEWBJRkvN]{Infested Cultist's Skull (Very Rare)}

@UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.sik1Lls618vPWhb4]{Lady's Veil}

@Embed[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.sik1Lls618vPWhb4]

@UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.XyQEY3jEM2lalQCH]{Longspike}

@Embed[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.XyQEY3jEM2lalQCH]

Very rare variant: Increase the DC to 16. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls you make with this magic weapon. While you are attuned to this weapon, it gains the Hyphal Parasite property.

OA: Hyphal Parasite. When you hit a creature with this weapon you can to force it to make a [[/save con dc=16 format=long]] as a bonus action. On a failure, the creature becomes afflicted by the @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.cIWJunlaFvcCbpPQ]{Fungal Infection} spell (no concentration required). After you cause a creature to make this saving throw, roll a [[/r d6]]. On a 1-2 you can’t activate this property again until the following dawn.

  • @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.XyQEY3jEM2lalQCH]{Longspike (Uncommon)}

  • @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.mUn74Pt6PhZkBvuG]{Longspike (Very Rare)}

@UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.rNPS84VXxjAo4iNF]{Mycelial Cloak}

@Embed[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.rNPS84VXxjAo4iNF]

@UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.8EqD5p3xNszBWPWK]{Overgrown Barkshield}

@Embed[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.8EqD5p3xNszBWPWK]

Rare variant: Increase Bark Armour’s temporary hit points to 3d8 and Vines and Thorns’ attack modifier and damage to +8 and 3d8, respectively.

Very rare variant: Increase Bark Armour’s temporary hit points to 5d8 and Vines and Thorns’ attack modifier and damage to +10 and 4d8, respectively.

  • @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.8EqD5p3xNszBWPWK]{Overgrown Barkshield (Uncommon)}

  • @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.Y8x9RBBWTihLic9E]{Overgrown Barkshield (Rare)}

  • @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.joXJJ6bASHe1da76]{Overgrown Barkshield (Very Rare)}

@UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.Lu2KymlT0K94U1s7]{Painblinder Mycaxe}

@Embed[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.Lu2KymlT0K94U1s7]

Rare variant: Increase Painblind Spores bonus to +3. While under the influence of Painblind Spores, you have advantage on Strength and Constitution checks as well as Strength and Constitution saving throws. Once you have benefitted from the Painblind Spores, you can’t benefit from them again until after you finish a short or long rest.

  • @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.Lu2KymlT0K94U1s7]{Painblinder Mycaxe Battleaxe (Uncommon)}

  • @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.PfUNlPNDWpJfek09]{Painblinder Mycaxe Battleaxe (Rare)}

  • @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.ScOGEKAXcQ41U1A9]{Painblinder Mycaxe Greataxe (Uncommon)}

  • @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.qAwkpJtgn3taySFl]{Painblinder Mycaxe Greataxe (Rare)}

  • @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.ua977NstDqztrLQf]{Painblinder Mycaxe Handaxe (Uncommon)}

  • @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.dsAKHPqycCAeNriQ]{Painblinder Mycaxe Handaxe (Rare)}

@UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.rCt4IpMCGwQSSOR5]{Ring of Fungal Symbiosis}

@Embed[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.rCt4IpMCGwQSSOR5]

Very rare variant: Increase all DCs to 16. When determining which mushrooms grow on your limb, increase the d4 to a d6, and add the following options:

  • Rheumshroom. As an action, a creature can throw this sticky mushroom at a point it can see within 60 feet of it, where it explodes in a 10-foot-radius sphere of arthritis-inducing spores. Each creature in the area must succeed on a [[/save con dc=16 format=long]] or suffer the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.yqUDoxk4x0NWG5Bz]{Slow} spell for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect for it on a success.
  • Zoomshroom. As an action a creature can eat this mushroom, gaining the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Szvk5FEVQW3uhJi5]{Haste} spell for 1 minute. At the start of each of the affected creature’s turns, roll a [[/r d6]]. On a 1, the effect ends and the wave of lethargy described in the spell sweeps over it.

  • @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.rCt4IpMCGwQSSOR5]{Ring of Fungal Symbiosis (Uncommon)}

  • @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.2Z3TKPH0NAcBWuLD]{Ring of Fungal Symbiosis (Very Rare)}

@UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.V0FvP3zYkwtHDhpt]{Sporespreader Rod}

@Embed[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.V0FvP3zYkwtHDhpt]

Rare variant: Increase the number of charges to 10 and the recharge to 1d6 + 4. Add the @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.Z4YoNd8AFxiLAkwW]{mortiferous pulse} (2 charges) and @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.l0oALTQuDQJE5vKv]{enrage} (3 charges) spells to the list of options.

  • @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.V0FvP3zYkwtHDhpt]{Sporespreader Rod (Uncommon)}

  • @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.9irxf4SNg1er8TP1]{Sporespreader Rod (Rare)}

  • @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.llYDyAPcFn06EcW5]{Sporespreader Staff (Uncommon)}

  • @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.ZqLNopuXd9znjsbW]{Sporespreader Staff (Rare)}

  • @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.AQAWhS4MYbc86wGL]{Sporespreader Wand (Uncommon)}

  • @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.DQclI6vOoSDbJ6rl]{Sporespreader Wand (Rare)}

Creatures.name: Creatures
Creatures.text:
Hyphans

Sharing a closer genealogy with the common toadstool than with any of the humanoid races, hyphans is the term used for the alien, fungal hive mind and the creatures it animates. Found underground, hyphans line vast subterranean caverns as stationary toadstools, penetrate tremendous expanses of rock and soil as microscopic mycelia, and infect the bodies of creatures. This latter form, though the least common, permits hyphans to interact with other creatures of The Low, while also providing defensive measures in response to incursions by greedy adventurers. All such creatures are part of a single entity, the hyphan colony. Any sensation one portion of the colony experiences, the rest of the colony comes to know about soon after.

Co-opted Assistance. A hyphan hive mind typically adapts an infected creature’s body into one of three archetypes: the brute, duskcap, or sporeslinger. These individuals must regularly return to the heart of their colony to be replenished and regain their vigour, lest they become decrepit, dessicated husks.

Hyphan Brute

@embed[Compendium.heliana-core.actors-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Actor.SS23hKolETs3nesb cite=false caption=false]{Decrepit Hyphan Sporeslinger}

@UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.actors-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Actor.V7drBLrgdDR6YvLI]{Vigorous Hyphan Sporeslinger}

Teamwork Trio. A brute, duskcap, and sporeslinger that bore an especially close connection pre-hyphanation can bring the experience of that teamwork into the hyphan colony. Such individuals often form teams of three, acting in concert to strike more often, and perform feats that lone hyphans cannot.
